revised_title: The Innervation of Renal Blood-Vessels and the Existence of Vaso-Dilator Nerves
tldr: This article investigates the origin, course, and nature of renal blood-vessel innervation in dogs. The authors found that the main supply of nerves for the renal vessels comes from the 10th to the 13th dorsal nerves. They also discovered that vaso-dilator nerves exist for the vessels of the kidney, which can cause renal expansion without affecting blood pressure.
